text: If I could give a negative star rating I would. The staff of the pharmacy is beyond rude. Like next level you need to go to some sort of basic manners school kind of rude! name: John Ward
text:
Ordered online got email to go collect and only some of order had arrived. Received no apology or help or info as to when to come back, Just a bad attitude.

Weeks later after finally getting my complete order and still no apology, i recieve an email from Walgreens asking for feedback. I gave a polite and accurste but negative review. Then recieved another email telling me the feedback left didn't meet their standards and bit had been moderated.

Walgreen, if you don't like negative feedback don't give negative service, and how dare you moderate my response.

name: April Juliana
text: Worst pharmacy in the world. Employees can not be bothered to try and help customers but can get an attitude and that seems to be fine.

name: Leslie L
text: My husband has a prescription he must have and Walgreens in Leeds Al. has this prescription. The drive through was closed today so I entered the store (not wanted to go inside trying to keep my husband as well as I can) the cashier, when I asked,  told me the pharmacy  was closed I asked to speak with the manager. The shift manager  can out and I asked him why the pharmacy  was closed he said someone  in the pharmacy tested positive  for COVID-19.  I told him I must have my husband's  prescription because  he could end up in the hospital  without it. His answer  was that he didn't  know when the pharmacy  would open back up and they were having the store cleaned  tonight by a professional cleaning  co. So what is a person to do if they depend  on a medication that they have a prescription for and can't  get it from the co. they have trusted to fill that prescription? The shift manager at 4:10 PM Tuesday  answer  was to call the doctor and get a new prescription sent to another store. I guess he doesn't  realize how difficult  it is to get intouch  with a doctor and a doctor at that time of day. Wouldn't  you think that the owner of this pathetic excuse  for a pharmacy would have had an emergency  plan in plan? We have been dealing with this Virus  for many months and a company this large should have a disaster plan in plan for just this type  of scenario. Pathetic. Everyone of my friends  has had a horrible  experience  with this store. We are going to flood the social media sources and expose  this company for who they are. They care nothing about the people  that keep them in business it's  all about money to this owner. Would you not think that they would close the whole store if someone  tested positive for COVID-19 I mean do they think that the virus decides to stay in one area of the store. Do they think that people  don't  go in there and touch products  before they go to the pharmacy. Just an example the bottom  line is money not care. Even Sonic  hamburger restaurant in Leeds Al. closed completely when one of it's employees tested positive and they sell burgers. The Walgreens in Leeds Al. Is absolutely  the worst pharmacy  in Leeds. You would think if they cared they would have had a disaster plan in place and they could have contacted all patrons that have life sustaining medications of the situation and where they could pick up their medication. There are many other drug stores  in Leeds and the surrounding area. I encourage  everyone who has had a dangerous experience with this co.to stop using  them and contact the head office. Good luck finding a competent person that works with this co. If I was a pharmacist  I would not want my name and reputation affiliated with Walgreens.

name: LaDeidra Scruggs
text: I really wish I had read these reviews before dealing with this pharmacist. I went in to get meds and Janeen slammed my meds on the counter and disappeared for like 7 minutes with my insulin. I’m happy I read these comments because I honestly thought I was being discriminated against. She was extremely rude and nasty to the point where I don’t trust my meds she disappeared with. I called and spoke to Trisha the store manager who claimed she reviewed the camera but she called me back in less than ten minutes. She must be great at operating cameras. I will never ever step foot inside this place again and if you’re smart you won’t either! If I could give this pharmacy negative stars I would.

name: Randy Dowling
text: Whether it's not being able to get your insurance figured out, or simply having your medication locked behind a computer system that's always down, or whatever the excuse of the day is, the pharmacy ALWAYS has something wrong. I've been using this pharmacy for years simply because it's on my way home, but I don't have time for this anymore. Considering I typically have to visit less than a couple of times a month, the rate of disappointment is comical.

name: Ak 205
text: Pharmacist here are rude, spiteful and out of control! It should not be that hard to get a prescription filled when your insurance WILL cover it and the doctors already sent it in electronically! They tell you to come pick it up then place it on delay when you complain. Do NOT put yourself in this nightmare! Walgreens needs to fire Janeen & hire new people. I’ve been with Walgreens for years and have never ever ever had these issues. Only with her!

name: Mohammad Rahman
text: Great staff! I have a basic understanding of all the checks and balances on how a prescription  is filled. Knowing what I know now, this pharmacy does an excellent job in providing me my medication. People don't understand how problematic an  insurance company can be in paying for a medication. With all the safety measures, calling doctors for problems with prescriptions and handling insurance companies/patients, I give this pharmacy 5 stars! Keep it up!

name: Jody Gray
text:
I am giving this store five stars for effort, when in reality, I have been so very frustrated with this pharmacy.  I have been a loyal Walgreens customer for at least 20 years, and have used Walgreens on the east coast, the west coast, and in between.  I’ve never had any issues with any other Walgreens as I have at this store.

To begin with, I’ve experienced phone wait times for up to an hour.  I just gave up on calling…I go directly to the pharmacy and wait to speak to the pharmacist.  I take a lot of meds, and there are times I have to personally request the pharmacy to fill certain prescriptions, as Walgreens online won’t allow me to electronically file certain scripts. Luckily I’m not far from the pharmacy, and driving over is no big deal for me. If you need to talk to someone in the pharmacy, just save yourself the frustration of calling.

I used to be a Job Coach, so I didn’t just want to hate this pharmacy…I wanted to understand what the problem was (is).  The problem is, they are always extremely busy, and maybe understaffed.  There have been times I have visited the store when there were at least 15 cars in line for the pharmacy; the line being wrapped around the building.  In addition there were also times where there were up to 10 people in line at the pharmacy.   I’ve sat and watched the employees working, and they are all working like crazy.  Nobody is on their phones, no one is standing around talking…they all seem to be working just as hard as they can.  In addition, I’ve always been treated with the level of kindness and professionalism that made me a loyal Walgreens customer many years ago. When I’ve been there I’ve heard the phone ringing constantly.  But In the pharmacy employees’ defense…they are so overwhelmed with customers in the store, no one has time to answer the phones.

Walgreens, if this pharmacy is understaffed, help them find some more employees!  There are a ton of people who depend upon this pharmacy for their medications.  Help this pharmacy to be better!

Sincerely, an extremely loyal Walgreens customer.

name: Jordan Arnold
text:
I went in with my mother to get a flu shot a couple days ago, and I wanted to get a video of me receiving a flu shot. (There are tons of videos circulating the internet of children, teens, and adults reacting to needles) and I was going to video myself receiving one with my mother's help because she too thought it would be funny.
We were both perfectly fine with putting our experience on camera, and did not feel as though it were violating our privacy.
The nurse, or woman with needle named Shay came in and just as my mother was about to get her shot, she tells me to turn off my camera. She would not provide services while being videoed. I was stunned and asked why and she proceeded to tell me it was a violation of HIPAA.
I was annoyed, but turned it off, not understanding what the deal was with videoing my esperience when countless others have done it IN DOCTORS OFFICES. When it came time for me to receive my shot she looked at me like I was crazy for jumping away from the needle and crying.
I DONT LIKE NEEDLES WHY DO YOU THINK I WAS RECORDING.
My arm was sore for days after the shot, which was probably my own doing for tensing up but she did nothing to even console her "patient". Not knowing much about HIPAA I went and asked some of my nursing friends and a phlebotomist I went to school with if there was a passage in HIPAA about a provider refusing service because of privacy on camera and both said no I even followed up on it by looking up HIPAA. Because the P in HIPAA stands for PATIENT not PROVIDER. Walgreens, if you don't want people videoing their experience (knowing what they are risking with their own privacy) please put up signs saying "no video or camera beyond this point" which will clear things up big time.
I will never get my flu shot at Walgreens again. Tell your "nurse" to work on their bedside manner.

name: Ebony Hickson
text:
I want to start off by saying, if you need quality hair, please don’t shop here. I want to save someone else from spending money they don’t have.
Disclaimer: This isn’t to “bash” but to literally to bring awareness to customers about the fraud of this shop.

On 1/30/21 I went to the Weave Zone in Huntsville,AL to purchase hair for graduation pictures. Graduation is something that I looked forward to because I’ve worked so hard and endured a lot along this journey so I decided to celebrate by taking pictures with a certain look. The look I was going for requires deepwave hair.
I purchased 4 bundles and spent a total of over $300.00. A day later I ran my fingers through one bundle and it was completely nappy and tangled. (Pictures will be attached)...

They gave me the run around and of course rude customer service but I’m from New York so that little attitude they gave didn’t phase me at all. I’m used to that.
They eventually exchanged it and I went about my way.
Now it’s time to wash the hair ....
I do hair and have been using bundle hair for years. The pattern completely dropped and ended up looking like straight hair.
I called the Weave zone and not to my surprise, they refused to compensate me or exchange my hair just because they exchanged a bad bundle. Keep in mind, all these issues were THEIR FAULT! Lol anyway...
As I said, no need to be disrespectful towards them in this review because I’ll let the pictures speak for themselves.
In closing, ladies , I’m sure you’re reading this review because you are contemplating spending your hard earned money in order to do something nice for yourself. Please go elsewhere, I highly advise it.
Am I disappointed? Highly. No one has 300 dollars sitting around but I strongly believe that when you’re dishonest, you won’t prosper. The weave zone isn’t exempt from that principle. Have a blessed day ladies!

EDIT/(2/7/21)

Ok let me blast you really quick... first of all, there was no harsh chemical. It’s a rinse where you put the NON-TOXIC RINSE, NOT A DYE, on the hair and simply wash it out. (I’ll attach pictures). Everyone knows what a rinse is. Secondly, as I showed your associate, the left bundle with the red rubber band WAS NOT RINSED!! So how do you explain that??? The crunchy bundle I exchanged was also not touched hence why it was exchanged.
My point is, the hair you gave me was NOT DEEP WAVE!!! Does that look like deep wave to you? Cut the foolishness. Your hair is trash and I stand by what I said. All proof is provided. How do you over process a non chemical rinse? Go back and look at the picture with the bundle in the red rubber band that wasn’t touched. You’re still going to tell me that’s a deepwave pattern? You’re missing the point of my review. My point is, that is NOT deepwave hair!!!! Instead of replying to me, go invest in a better vendor.

resp.text: Ebony, our hair is 1B. You applied a chemical and over-processed the hair. Our store policy is once a product has been chemically altered, we do not accept refunds nor exchanges. We stand behind our  commitment to providing high quality hair for prices our dolls can bare!

name: Dalphne Abernathy
text: Ms. Kiala presented me with excellent customer service. She was very patient and knew her product well. I would highly recommend The Weave Zone for a complete professional outcome.

resp.text:
Kendra,

Thank you for contacting us! Our prices are set by our corporate offices and our employees cannot make changes to them.

For discounts and exclusive sales, text WEAVEZONE to 474747.

You can always check out our weekly online deals on our website —- www.TheWeaveZone.com

and called and can't get a return call and apparently email isn't good either I never could get a response when I was trying to track the wig down the first time to see why I hadnt received it and never got a response back

resp.text:
Shawnda,

Thank you for contacting us! We appreciate your feedback and thank you for taking the time to leave such a detailed review.

Your order was shipped and delivered in accordance with our shipping policies stated on our website. Holidays, warehouse sales and shipping delays can affect your shipping speed which is why we have options for Express shipping available to our customers who are in a rush.

In an effort to provide the best and most efficient customer experience, we have a very detailed Customer Care section of our website. Additionally, you received a reply to your email within 30 minutes that also shared the answer to your question. Please check your Spam folder because you may have missed it :(

We appreciate your business and hate to learn that you are unsatisfied with your product! If it is still in the original packaging and hasn’t been altered, will you stop by our retail location so that we can make it right for you?

Please give us a call today if you’d like us to put another wig of equal value to the side for you to come and review ❤️

text:
I ordered a wig for pick up which stated it will be 3-5 days after the 5 days I never heard anything I reached out after the week I was told but the young girl that they waiting on shipment call back in 2-3 days I called back in 3 days a man answer the phone he stated we just waiting on the shipment I’ll put you on the list and give you a call sometime in the afternoon to give you update I received no call. I waited two more days and called back and the man answer and stated I have your name listed with several other names to call once it comes this is the 2nd week and 2nd time I had to reschedule a hair appointment. This week is the third week I called Monday and was told by the young girl I spoke with my manager and we don’t have your wig but we have a wig that’s longer and I’ll put that to the side with you with your order number and name and phone, the next day my sister went to pick up my hair the man was there he had no clue I was coming and after 25 min waiting my sister said he gave you the wig you ordered instead of what they told you on the phone. So I waited 3 weeks for my hair that I was told by a young girl and manager that they didn’t have so I was going to get a longer wig to get the same wig I was promised literally a day before no money back no percentage off no nothing. Then I opened the bag of hair it smelled like a full zoo!! Promise  I would never recommends this business they obviously don’t know what be going on don’t know anything and they lie to customers I guess just to avoid there mess up.

Please don’t let them fool you I have screenshots of all the calls all the the recordings of the lies I was told. Don’t shop I was literally told not to shop with them and I still did now I know why it will never happen again.

resp.text:
Porcha,

First, I’d like to thank you for choosing The Weave Zone! We value your support and value this review.

This feedback is important to us because it demonstrates areas for further new employee training as we provide new services to our customers.

We’d love the opportunity to make this right for you. One of our Management team members will reach out to you today. ❤️

name: Kanesha JS, M.S. IT MNGT
text:
I wouldn’t recommend purchasing hair from the Weave Spot.

Today, I purchased hair and it appeared to be the same pattern as the the closure which was deep wave. Once the hair was wet it was completely different. Called the store and the sales person states once you take it out the pack it’s out of there hands! I went to the store and the salesman told me I used old hair. I’m not understanding why I would purchase hair then turn around and use old hair. That’s makes no sense! I proceeded to ask for a manager first he stated the manager wasn’t there then he stated there was no manager. I’m confused. So who is the owner?! He gave me a business card which was the store number. Before even asking what the issue was he over talked me to say once it’s out the bag it’s out of our hands.

KNOW YOUR PRODUCT PRIOR TO SELLING IT FROM PEOPLE!

Some people shouldn’t sell hair. Some people need customer service skills prior to working in a customer service position. Good customer service is vital in the hair industry.

resp.text: Hi Kanesha. Sorry and shocked to hear about your experience. Best way to reach customer service is by email. Our email is theweavezone@gmail.com. Please send us a email and we will get back with you ASAP.

name: Tina Ellis
text:
I moved here three years ago and haven't let anyone but Demetra do my hair. After looking through reviews and other people in town that can do my extensions (Yep White girls do it to) I decided to give Demetra a chance. Three years later and she's still the only one in the city of Huntsville that I'll even give the time of day to. Not only is she professional but always polite and suggest different ways to do my extensions. Before meeting her I didn't know anything about beading. I always had my hair braided and then sewn in. She ensured me that beading was the way to go and would stand longer then braiding with my type of hair. Not only did she do an amazing job but she went above and beyond to even meet me at different hair sales places to make sure I had the highest quality of extensions but the exact color I needed. I would recommend Demetra to anyone even the girls at school have gotten to know her and use her. I love getting my hair done by her.

❤️Tina❤️

name: Trina H
text:
BBB COMPLAINT AND SMALL CLAIMS FORTHCOMING

I purchased several of the longer 5A bundles, and a closure, on 3/13/19 at the Huntsville, AL University Drive store to be in a wedding. The hair was BEAUTIFUL, until shampooed on 3/17/19 with Tresemme products, and immediately lost all curl pattern. I was the only one in the wedding party with straight hair, and the bride was so disappointed because that was not the look agreed upon. Nevertheless, after speaking with the owner, Tony, who agreed that should not have happened to the hair, and texting him the requested pictures and receipt, I didn't hear back from him. Perplexed, I called the next day, and Tony placed me on hold for 23 minutes! Giving the business the ultimate benefit of the doubt, I waited and called again the next day. Tony was unavailable, but Keyshonna (sp?) told me she had seen the texts from me, and to bring in the hair, along with the receipt, for replacement hair. She told me to call before coming into the store. I could not make it HSV soon, so I called to inform them.  Tony and Keyshonna were unavailable when I called, but I spoke to Lawrence, who kept telling me to call back because they were moving. In anticipation of miscommunication, I texted after each call, just to make sure! Days later, I get to speak to Lawrence, and he finally speaks to Keyshonna about the issue, who remembered me from bringing up the wedding. They discussed it, and informed me that Tony doesn't remember me, and they won't replace or refund the purchase, since it was worn - which all parties knew based on 1) the pictures sent and 2) each text and 3) each conversation!

As a consumer, I legit waited weeks and several calls and texts to attempt to fix the issue. It hurts me to even have to write this review, and to announce the customer service practices of this business. However, they made it extremely hard to ignore. As a practicing attorney, I have filed accompanying complaints with BBB and BBB of North Alabama, and have all the time and evidentiary proof to file in small claims court over $245, plus legal costs and fees....which is just sad because all I wanted was some long curly hair, and not another court date.

text: Don't know where to start. Most people like this place, but don't go if you don't know what you want. I told them my symptoms (and meds) and was pushed to buy 2 products. Got home to research and both items interfered with my medications. Taking items back is like you broke some major rule. It is frowned upon. Not that they care, but I won't be back.

resp.text:
Jeanna, I am so sorry about your experience, and I hope that you will change your mind and give us another chance. Our employees are not allowed to give medical advice. Our policy is to tell you to talk to your pharmacist about possible interactions. That being said, the internet is NOT a good place to research that information. I implore you to ask your pharmacist.

As for feeling frowned upon for a return, please understand that we are human and are capable of allowing our emotions to show on our sleeve as much as anyone, but I will talk to the employee that assisted you and let her know that she made you feel badly.

Again, I apologize for your experience and hope that you will give us a chance to make it right.

I waited another 10 minutes as I put my info into a system and purchased the item online for pickup in store and waited for it to come across the system. Where is the transparency? Where is the customer service?

name: 1Alone
text:
done with this location! pharmacy employees have gotten very cold to the customer! it's almost as if they are mad at something! when asking a question, the response is distant and cold. at one time this was a friendly location. whether it is new management or whatever, it is no excuse to treat customers like this! will be writing a letter to the corporate office on this for sure! maybe EVERY one of the pharmacy cashiers should take a class on "customer relations" or just "general kindness".... especially the ones working on 3/23/21 around lunch time! either way, won't be doing business here no longer!
UPDATE! COUNT YOUR PILLS BEFORE LEAVING THIS PHARMACY!

if you are picking up pain meds from here, I suggest you count them before leaving the register!

name: Sondra Personal
text:
I was the only person in the drive through. The employee in the window was busy ,so I waited a few minutes before the drawer opened and I could tell her I was dropping off a prescription. It took a few minutes for her to look over the prescription, then drive off.
I get a voicemail my prescription is ready, so I go to pick it up. I am the 3rd person in the drive through and wait 30 minutes. I give the employee my name, then my address, paid, and left within a minute. What took the 2 cars before me so long?
If this was a one time thing, no problem. But this is a regular occurrence  with this particular Walgreens. I only go there because Walgreens bought Rite Aid which had been my pharmacy for years.

name: Brad Miller
text: This is one of the worst pharmacies I've ever been to. And I've been to pharmacies in Mexico if that says anything. You'd think that the employees were sloths. Everything takes forever and the employees could care less. It's not uncommon to sit in the pickup line for 30 minutes with only 2 cars in front of you. Be prepared to wait even longer if you go inside.

text: Called a day ahead, for insulin pen refill. Called again to find out still in que, went to window and said come back in one hour. Came back and said not in stock. Maybe tomorrow a shipment might come in. How would you react?

Last order was 2 cards to be picked up at 9:00 and told by sales associate, Frances that my order was not ready and there was mo way my order would be ready that evening...very rude.

text: If I could give them zero stars I would. The rudest staff in the pharmacy I've ever seen. The person helping me complained that she had to spend 20 minutes of her time helping me. REALLY??? Isn't she getting paid to do that? That is the last time I will go in there!

text: RUDE!!! Always slow. Never offer to help with anything. I asked if they could call cvs across the street and see if they had something in stock and the employee’s response was “that would take me a long time, I can’t”. They will never have my business! CVS is so much better.

text: It’s a very slow pharmacy. I always get calls saying my prescription is ready. I drive 30 minutes to the store, use the drive thru, which is usually 4-5 cars in line, once at window they have not filled anything and I’m asked to come back in 15-20 minutes. I really wish they’d get some kind of organization or experienced help at this location.

name: Kathy Loggins
text: Will not be back, the advertised price on the marque and by the product was clearly labeled the product range up full price cashier would not give me said product at stated price even though they were marked in 3 different places, then she had nerve to ask me to restock if I did not want them.  Sorry left them at register for her to restock that is in her job description not mine.  Went else where found sane items for better price.

name: Mary Jane Powell
text: Hate to even give 1 star. These  are rude people in the pharmacy department.  They need to just hire all new staff for the front pharmacy.  Never had to deal with the actual pharmacist they may be good but the staff gets a zero.

name: Cody Britton
text: I started using this location as my pharmacy when I moved to Gardendale from Fultondale. It's been a terrible experience time after time. I now travel 15 minutes to the Fultondale location (vs about 3min to this location) just to avoid this terribly run operation.

name: Mariah Huffman
text: Went in (03/13/18 around 8pm) and they had exactly what I needed!! However once I got to the cashier (young black female) she was very rude and not helpful at all when I asked when would they restock the shelf near her register where I got the last of some candy, had a “I only work here” attitude!!

name: Pete Odom
text:
After answering all questions asked by pharmacy cashier, I was told that I would be advised when single prescription was ready. It was apparent that the pharmacy was busy so I waited patiently in the pharmacy seating area. After approximately 40 minutes,  noticing that the seating area had emptied out at least 2 times, I once again went to cashier. Original cashier wasn't there any longer so I spoke to another who looked up my request.
I was told that nothing had been entered and had to once again answer basic questions.  Once that was done my prescription was filled Immediately.
I believe the pharmacist there are very professional but there seems to be an issue with attitude at the cashier level. Since there were several cashiers at the windows,  I don't believe it was an issue of inadequate staffing.

name: Chris Adams
text:
Typical overpriced specialty retailer.  The pharmacy is ok although it is so rare that I use them I can't speak much to that.  Usually, it's that I need something on the fly and they happen to be close by.  Everything is priced for people that use their card.  I can't stand all this card nonsense almost everywhere you go.  Price is $2.99 then get to the register and it's $5.99 without the card or whatever.  Random but don't bother buying ice cream here as they can't even handle it correctly so it melts by the time the get it put up so when you buy it it's iced up and no longer creamy as it should be.  Yes, that's an odd thing to mention but hey at least now you know.

Walgreens, stop with the card nonsense...seriously it's just ridiculous.

I'll go here if I have to for a prescription once every year or so but other than that it's just not worth coming here.

name: Meota Meow
text:
My insurance forces me to use Walgreens and I hate every time I go get anything for my dad since he is diabetic which means I frequently shop here to my dismay. No one should have to put up with nasty pharmacists or just staff who dont care? Called just today because we could only afford half of the insulin at the beginning of the month I call and I'm told that I didnt pick it up in a timely matter and that now the order is put back. Honestly I called for medicine not to be lectured rudely about something I cant control social security picks the day it arrives every month not me but before I could even explain she tells me I have to go get another copay dr visit to get more insulin then after talking a little more she says he has refills so which is it do I need to get my dr or does he have refills how much is it going to cost am I going to have to pay for a full prescription and she really just talked in a circle so I got off the phone

If you dont have to use them JUST DON'T there is  cvs across the street  just go there it cant be any worse then this wallgreens simply not possible

name: Brannon Herzing
text: Extremely rude lady working in the pharmacy. I did not get a name, because she was not wearing a name tag. They tell you a prescription is ready, but then make you wait till they fill it.

name: Kacey Lipscomb
text: Always friendly and helpful

name: Alexandra Hunter
text: I was just on hold for 25 min and they hung it up. Then I called back and I was on hold for 25 more min and they hung it up. I called back and it said there was more than 4 people ahead of my call. It’s always like this every time I call.

name: Ann Davis
text: Wait on prescriptions is too long.  Drive through very slow.

name: A L
text: I have had a total knee replacement. I wanted to fill my Percoset prescription. Pulled in drive thru, my friend driving put the prescription in box, the tech was just standing there watching, let the prescription fly out of the box on the ground. I couldn't get out and my friend has a bad hip so that was difficult. They said it would be about 25 minutes as usual.  We pulled off. Did another errand which took longer went back to Walgreens.....the same tech looks at us and says we can't fill the prescription because our system is down. Well why in the hell couldn't they call me and say they couldn't fill it? I was hurting and needed my meds. Does anybody have common sense any more? Had to get prescription and go to CVS wait another 20 minutes.  I never had trouble with RITE AID IN FULTONDALE. THEIR STAFF WAS VERY SMART. I AM GOING TO SEE IF MY INSURANCE IS ACCEPTED AT THAT LOCATION  WHICH IS NOW WALGREENS. SAME NAME BUT THE STAFF MAKES THE DIFFERENCE. THEY HAVE COMMON SENSE.

name: Charles McKinney
text: Pharmacy staff is friendlier than most. Store layout is nice.

name: Sully Peterson
text: Worst pharmacy staff I’ve ever had the displeasure of dealing with. I wish they’d hire more qualified and friendly workers.

name: LaNita Young
text: I am a customer at the Sumiton/Dora, Al Walgreens Drugs.  I have always been treated professionally and got very timely service at that store.  One day last week they were out of one of my meds so they called this Walgreens at Gardendale as I happened to be in that area; they had it so I went by to pick it up.  The whole staff in the pharmacy treated me horrible.  Beginning with totally ignoring me when I stood at the counter for several minutes with 5-6 people working in there and no one but me at the counter!  When some one finally did wait on me, my med was not ready; before all the ugliness was over they had kept me in there for over an hour while they waited on around 10-12 other customers not counting the drive thru!  Much more was said and went on towards me that was not professional nor was I treated fairly, however, I have already written a book and can not say it all here so I will write headquarters.  I did nothing nor said anything to them at first to deserve this treatment; but the more they pushed my buttons the more I got upset.  I still held myself back to what a lot of folks would have done.  This happened on the day crew July 5, 2017.  Thanks for letting me rant!

name: Russell Meyers
text:
Typical Montgomery "professionalism".
Scheduled an MMR vaccine online yesterday. Got there few minutes ahead. They tell me they are doing vaccines in the drive-through. (?!)
What if a person has no vehicle? Not my case but true for some.
Go to drive-through. They ask for ID, fine. Then a bunch of other questions. They say they cannot find my appointment in the system. Then tell me to schedule another appointment online for this morning. Not happy but I did. (Note they did not ask if I had time this morning.)
I call to confirm an hour ahead. Getting through their phone system, the recording tells me no appointment is necessary for a vaccine. Hmm.
Pharmacist gets on the line, tells me that their MMR is out of stock. Something they could have told me yesterday.
Drama, poor work ethic, worked harder to NOT do something than they would if they had just done it.
Purely unprofessional.

name: Ice

text:
I've always had good service at this location.  It's convenient and would hate to see it closed because of it being so convenient.
There are times when certain medications have been out of stock, but guess that can happen anywhere.
The staff has always been very nice to me.
If I ever have a problem with a staff member being rude, have no qualms about asking that person what is the problem, but I've also worked with the public and know that the public can be extremely demanding and unreasonable.

name: Joshua Heath
text: Absolutely terrible, was on hold for 15 minutes. Decided I didn’t want to wait on the phone any longer so I went in the store to see that the phone was ringing and nobody would answer it. Then stood in line for 20 more minutes, only to find out my prescription wasn’t ready yet. So I have to wait 30 more minutes for it to get ready. If they would’ve answered the phone, it would’ve been ready by now. This is terrible service and the old white guy in the white coat is ridiculous. He apparently doesn’t know how to answer the phone.... must think his paycheck is to much to answer a phone. I wish Riteaid was still open, they were 1,000 time better, faster, and friendlier.

text: I visit this Walgreens three times the first time the woman at the counter was very rude to the woman that was in the drive thru then she was taking forever the next day it took about 20 minutes and the third day went through the drive-through to 15 minutes turned around went inside took another 35 minutes was nobody at the counter very poor drugstore the one at Jackson's is a very good quality friendly fast service drugstore the one at Jackson's hospital is a 100 this is maybe scored a 45

She was rolling her eyes, I was talking to her and she hung up, and it looked like to me she was more concerned with cutting up with another employee. They never found him to get the prescription, and my sick husband had to go up there to get the prescription within minutes he got it. We'll be going to another pharmacy from now on!

name: Jerry Terry
text: I received a coupon for a free mini facial after making purchases at the L'Occitane location in Birmingham.  I scheduled an appointment for July 4 at 11:30.  When I arrived on time for my appt.  I was told by the clerk that she was the only one in the store and whoever scheduled my appointment made an error in scheduling.  She asked if I could shop for 30 mins and return at 12 p.  I was fine with that and left the store to browse for 30 minutes.  When I returned the clerk I spoke with had already taken someone to the back for service and the other clerk informed her that I was back.  They chatted for awhile, then the other clerk told me that it would be a little while and signaled with her hands (in a shooing motion) to "um, just look around for awhile". This was completely unacceptable and needless to say, I left the store without receiving the facial for the following 1) if there was an error with the schedule I should have been called and asked to reschedule instead of having me drive to the location and then be told there was an error. 2) Why was someone else being serviced at the time I was told to return.  Did that person have to wait? 3)To date no manager from the store has called to try to reschedule or return my calls.  I will not be visiting this store again!

text:
These Pharmacy techs are awesome and always have a great attitude.

I love coming here there is never any confusion.

Always knowledgable and always have my prescription on time!  Thank you ladies and gentleman!

name: Jay Rock
text: The Pinson Walgreens is a store with friendly customer service and there’s always a smiling face to greet you .

name: Josh kaley
text: Mixed opinions.  Had a female cashier that was great, very friendly and went out of her way to help.   The pharmacy on the other hand, bad attitudes and not very helpful.  They just want to fill scripts and be left alone.  I usually go somewhere else

name: Amanda Bruton
text: Walgreens is always on top of everything! I never seem to wait on line for anything. They are quick and efficient with prescriptions and there is never a line to check out. The store stays clean and they keep the shelves stocked really well. The manager helped me find everything I needed plus a little more.

name: Makynleigh Adderhold
text: The male pharmacist that I dealt with is incompetent! Very rude and unprofessional!!! I would rather chew off my arm then deal with him ever again. The woman are awesome! Thanks to the “man” I will no longer use this pharmacy. He is not right for the line of work he is in.

name: Michael Myers
text:
Couldn't ask for better photo help. Lady at front desk was very helpful and courteous.
She was effecient and help me much.
Made my dead lines. CVS's photo machines were down at three locations.. Thank you Walgreens photo lady. 11-18-19 @ 10:30am.

name: Erica
text: They are always friendly when you walk in, you can find a lot of things on sale or marked down

name: Danny Joiner
text: Used to be Rite Aid. Same employees mostly. Never had any issues with refills or knowledgeable help from the pharmacist.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Friendly and helpful staff

name: Sose Knows Best
text: Just moved to Pinson and I was wanting to transfer my RX to this Walgreens but after sitting on hold for over 30 minutes, I hung up and called Publix down the road and spoke with a pharmacist with no wait.

name: Don Mabry
text: Not open as stated.  Tried to go here at 12:05 08/01/2021 and doors locked, no one there.  Walgreens really let me down when this location indicated online as being open 24hrs.  Whatever.  Went to CVS, and will only go CVS forward.

name: Jade Skye
text: There was an entire rack of items advertised on sale and they wouldn't honor the price. They wouldn't give me the price it was marked at. Shalia wouldn't even go back there and look. I didn't have time to argue so I just decided from now on I'll go across the street to CVS. Enjoy this 1 star review to go along with all the other 1 star reviews.

name: Destini R
text: I went in yesterday to get my passport picture taken. I was told to leave my number so they could give me a call when it was ready because there were a few orders ahead of me, so I did. I decided to wait around town because I thought surely it wouldn’t take over two hours, I was wrong. I never even got a call. I went back today to tell them I wanted to pick up my picture, because surely it was done and printed. When she asked for my name, she couldn’t find my picture? I told her I took it yesterday and was told I’d get a call when it was ready and didn’t think it would take 24hrs. She had to find my picture herself on the camera and print it out because the other woman did not do it. No wonder I didn’t recieve a call... It wasn’t even being printed.

name: Gin Lee
text:
24/ 7. Hours.
Great local pharmacy.

I quit going to Walgreens 2 years ago because of the lack of help from the employees. I will go back to Walgreens because of Shanetra.

text: The pharmasist were professional but some of the attendants are rude and not helpful and clearly do not appreciate their job. Sometimes we dont appreciate the water untill the well runs dry. text: Wait only around 30 seconds for someone to answer the phone. They were very courteous and answered my questions quickly. I always get my prescriptions filled here with no issues. This was in the middle of the day and not at off hours.

name: Diana Parker
text: Worst pharmacy I’ve ever been to. After waiting over an hour on a prescription with my sick child I was then told they were out of the specific medication I needed. I asked them when I gave them the prescription and they said it would be ready shortly. Then when I questioned why they didn’t tell me when I brought it in that they were out I was threatened by the manager of the store. I would never go back there again. I will drive out of my way before going back there.

name: Chris Cobb
text: The customer service at this location has ALWAYS been awesome. The name of cashier isn't on the receipt, that I saw, but he always is very curteous and very helpful. Everything and everyone has an off day but I've never been disappointed here.

name: michael d mcgee
text: THEY WON'T EVEN ANSWER THE PHONE!

name: Brandi L Boyd
text: Slowest pharmacy ever!! Only plus is it's 24 hours!! I take a substantial amount of meds so there are times I need after regular pharmacies close...so they're my last resort

name: Samuel Stockman
text: Long wait for simple order. Pickup was at 2, wasnt ready until after 230 after we asked they started to fill it

name: Eric Pilkinton
text:
Pharmacy doesn't pick up the phone. Customer service is lacking. Won't be using this location again.

.... A week later I tried going through the drive-thru and after 15 minutes one car has not moved from the window. Another 5 minutes and I decide to leave after watching three other cars pull off. Absolutely horrible. Wouldn't even answer their phone when I tried to call to find out what was going on. Changing Pharmacy. Done with this place.

name: Andrew Marut
text: This place is the absolute worst pharmacy I have ever been to. They want you as the patient to do their job, when they should be taking care of sick people, not making more issues. Pick up the phone and call the doctor if things are not in order, don’t call the sick patient and expect them to call. YOU ARE THE PHARMACIST, YOU DO YOUR JOB 😡

name: Alyssa Bush
text: Ive only used this pharmacy since I moved to Northport and honestly I've never had a problem with them. I see a lot of negative reviews for this walgreens but maybe theyve had a change of staff since most of those were posted. As for the cashiers and other staff members, they're also great! They've never failed to impress me.

name: Amanda
text: Had a bad experience with a passport photo. They took forever taking the photo due to the camera dying and not having enough memory. The staff kept having to take my young child's photo because of the camera and took about 6 picture before it got right.  Took about 45 minutes. Submitted the photo with our application but it was denied due to the size of the head being too large. So we had to retake the photo at walgreens again and PRAY we get our passport in time for a very expensive trip. If we do not we will have to expedite new paperwork and this will all be due to walgreens not resizing the photo correctly. We asked for a refund which they would not give. The staff was as helpful as the could be on the first visit and I do not blame them for the equipment failure. But i believe due to their error we should have been offered a new photo and refund.

name: Voodoo Actual
text: I waited about 25 minutes to drop off a prescription. That's right - just to drop it off. When I finally got to the counter I was told they couldn't take any more prescriptions since they were so busy. I let the young lady know that I was just dropping it off for later when suddenly a sweaty behemoth of a pharmacist appeared. He informed me that he was to busy and he wouldn't fill it later either. I was further told that I should go somewhere else. No problem. This was my first and last experience with Walgreens - never spent a dime and never will. They should be required to pay me for my time though.

name: Julie Woosley
text: Most of the workers are nice, but there is always a long line at the pharmacy. Waited about 30 minutes tonight to pick up some medicine.

name: Sarah Cheshire
text: Considering how your pharmacy made millions monopolizing all the AL blue cross plans this year, one would think you would be able to invest more in customer service. I've spent 2 hours on hold today and each time I call a different assistant answers and can't seem to track down my prescription. Have called my doc multiple times to confirm that it is there. Am now on hold for the third time today an my doctors office is about to close and I'm starting to experience side effects from not being able to get my meds. This is not the first time this has happened. Shame on Walgreens for taking state ACA $ but not using it to provide decent care.

name: Mastershy 771
text: It took 4 hours to get my meds filled! Go to Jann's Pharmacy! They are great!

name: Paul Sturdivant
text: Pharmacy always very busy and today is the busiest I have ever seen it. This raises a question, is their service that bad or maybe their prices are that good  ?  You decide !!

name: JERRY LOUIE
text: Longest wait ever in pharmacy drive thru. Was dropping off Mother inlaw prescription. About 48 minutes.

name: Brittany Turner
text: Probably the worst pharmacy in Tuscaloosa. The pharmacist on staff seems to always be rude. Just not worth the trouble

name: Steven Galvez
text: Used pharmacy service..was quick

name: J. Morgan Curl
text: Went to pickup a Western, at the signing point, the signing pinpad malfunctioned and waited 30 minutes for it to come up.  Employees were polite, but equipment issues will keep me from EVER using Walgreens for Western Union again.

name: Parker Files
text:
EMBARASSING for a pharmacy to be this lackadaisical about keeping things from being expired!! I won't be coming back.

Got some pain meds for my kidney stone. Figured what the heck Ill get a pepsi. NBD right? Wrong. Flat as a blade.
Returned it.
Got a coke. Even worse.
Returned it.
Went around the store and I cant find ANY cokes that arent expired and pepsis that are only good to like november and January in a few rare cases. Are their inventory people in a coma? Did they die? Get your meds here but dont shop here.

text: The store itself is great but the pharmacy is terrible!

name: Anna Martin
text: This pharmacy is TERRIBLE!! Twice now they've told me to wait 15 min while they get my prescription ready and I ended up waiting AN HOUR AND A HALF this is completely unacceptable. Every time I go to pick up my prescription they give me the generic of my brand when I specifically tell them that I want the brand and to never assume to give me the generic. Today I have called 5 times, my call has never been answered despite being on hold 15 min each time I call. I am switching all of my prescriptions to CVS. I'm done wasting my time and money, Walgreens has forever lost my service at every location.

They usually have to search and search for my already prepared prescription. After a year, I am moving my prescriptions because it is the same experience each time.

text:
I am writing this review to draw attention to a serious matter regarding the offensive behavior exhibited by Manager Beth. The incident occurred on the evening of 07/22/2021 at the Alabaster Alabama location. I frequently visit the Alabaster location, however Sales Manager Beth made my experience horrible. Due to the negative experience,  I will never visit that particular location.I’ve never been so disappointed with service.
I reported the horrible experience to customer service and I am hopeful that the problem will be corrected but I would like to make all shoppers aware. A shopping experience should be delightful and not confrontational.

Happy shopping!!

name: T
text:
I purchased items at a store and I forgot a coupon. I went back and brought the items to get the coupon added. The lady said one of the items was not on the receipt. That wasn’t my fault. So, instead of letting me keep the free item (THAT WASNT ADDED) she charge me for it and added my coupon towards it. I got annoyed and told her to just add charge me for the item and I’ll pay the difference with the coupon added. INSTEAD, she refunded everything and recharge me again for the full price. I check my balance and it still show I’m currently charge for two amounts. I did get a refund. I’ll wait 3-5 days but if I don’t get my money back. We got a problem.

Instead of getting a free bonus air freshener. I got charge extra for something that wasn’t added and lost a free item. I WAS BASICALLY BETTER NOT RETURNING BACK TO THE STORE.

name: Monique Moore
text: I was very excited when I found out there would be a Bath and Body Works in my area. I went once before with no problem. I went tonight and there were 2 customers there me another lady. I stood in line for a very long time while the lady in front of me was being assisted. Once it was my turn I asked the sales associate behind the counter if they only had 1 register open? When she tried to respond the manager comes over and was very rude and said yes there are no customers here so we just have one and walked away. I advised her that she was very rude and left the items there. The manager at this store needs more customer service training, you had more employees working than customers but I still waiting a lengthy time to be helped and she laughed like she didn't care. I will be reporting this to corporate.

name: Veronica Ramos
text: I went in yesterday and let me just say. There was a employee there who didn’t know what she was doing. On Bath and Body Works webiste it advertised a sale in store and online for any select lotions for $3.95. I grabbed my Japanese Cherry blossom body cream and went to go check out. It rung up at $13.00. I politely asked why didn’t it pop up at $3.95. She said what do you mean? I showed her the page and said there’s a sale going on. She proceeded to say “I need to see a barcode to scan” Clearly there was no bar code but she proceeded to roll her eyes and scan a peice of paper to give the discount. Other than that. I had a good experience.

text:
Does anybody know the name of the Pharmacy Manager and how to contact them?

Must admit…a person from the store did call me to resolve my problem. But the name of the manager remains a mystery to me…

text: Just meet someone there didn't go inside

name: Angie Brabham
text: Great photo quality on prints, but do your photo selection online. Usually only one kiosk is working and it's slow. Worst experience I've had with them was today with an employee adamant that my online order was not there. He did not want to listen to me explain how this was the 2nd time an online special order had been sent there by corporate and all I had to do was pick it up. He was so persistent that I was wrong and he was right. Finally he found my order, but didn't apologize for misunderstanding, but said, "Corporate did this, not us." Okay, what does that matter to me? I showed him the confirmation email that it had been paid for but he still did not believe me and got a manager. Finally the manager showed him that it was sent here, paid for, for me to pick up. Might as well paid shipping to my house for that customer service, or lack there of!

name: Amber Williams
text: Very quick and friendly!

name: Dominique Lee
text: Very helpful staff.

name: Anthony Melton
text: Super service.

name: jonah flowers
text: Horrible Customer Service, Never Have My Prescriptions Ready Or In Stock, And Had A Nasty Attitude After Been On Hold For 15mins

name: Jubilee Dueck
text: This place doesn't even deserve a one-star. One of the technicians here stole half of my prescriptions. Now, I'm from out of town and this was my first and last time using this Walgreens. I went on a Thursday evening, and dropped off my prescriptions, then I went out to dinner. Afterwards I came back to Walgreens, there was a brunette at the register who was rude. I thought, she must be tired because she didn't look too good. I paid for my medication and walked out of the pharmacy. I went back to my place and noticed half the prescription was missing! I thought that's strange half my medication is missing and I just left the pharmacy that's never happened before, so I assumed it was probably a mistake.  When I finally got in contact with the pharmacy, I explained what happened and a woman responded saying she needed to check their records. After a few seconds she comes back on the line to tell me their counts for the prescriptions were accurate and she couldn't do anything about it. I said, I will come up there with the prescription bottles to discuss this! Then she proceeds to tell me she's the Pharmacy's Manager. At this point, I was getting upset! I told her this pharmacy charged me FULL price for a months supply of prescriptions then only gave me half of it. I told her, I had to pay out of pocket for this and I want to be reimbursed.  She continued to say there's nothing she could do.  Well, that's just too bad, because for a "Manager" not to even attempt to investigate  problems when a customer is genuinely upset and telling the truth about a bad experience just baffles me. Why isn't this manager more concerned that a technician took someone elses medicine from the pharmacy's safe and then falsifed records to get away with it?! She's kept saying there's nothing she could do. Really?! Why don't you fire the employee, so this doesn't happen again. Stealing medicine is illegal, but it's ok I know EXACTLY what to do and I will be making a police report about that employee and this Pharmacy.

name: Fred Shiels
text: I gave one star because they didn’t have an option for Zero!!!  These people at the Carter Hill store are the most RUDE, unprofessional “employees” I have ever encountered anywhere. I fail to see how any of them keep a job. Today will most definitely be my last visit to this Walgreens. I guess I should say shame on me... cause I gave them a second chance too. There won’t be a third.

name: Chava Jancaterino
text: I get great service here. The employees are always friendly and helpful.

name: Charge Barge
text: My experience sucked.  They apparently lost my first prescription on a controlled substance.  The pharmacist thought I was lying at first, assuming I was out for drugs.  Then realized that I got a notification from them that my prescription was delayed for the prescription prior to stopping by to pick it up.  They then apologized without giving me my medications.  It was out of their hands, so, I figured, no big deal.  I sent in the second one without a problem.  Today, I returned and I found out they're waiting for a prior authorization for the second medication.  The first one in the morning called my doctor's office and told them to disregard the first prior auth, and then the second pharmacist (Brittni H.) in the afternoon was still waiting for the prior auth that the first one was supposed to send.  Now, prior authorizations take a while to process, so they sadly just wasted a whole day of lack of processing, much to the chagrin of both me and my physician's staff (since we were both given the runaround).  I should really sue the pants off the pharmacists involved in these shenanigans here.

name: Tyler Moran (TylerT)
text: Ordered some pictures online and were able to pick them up the same day.

name: Sarah Spratling
text: Good drug store with knowledgeable clerckd

name: Bella Aaron
text: That star rating is actually a negative number one! Worst Walgreen's ever. I gave them a second chance and learned a second time not to go here. They have never had any of my prescriptions in stock EVER! What good is a pharmacy that when you get out of a hospital and need it they tell you they can have it in a couple of days? Especially if your life depends on it. Worst part is, they don't call and tell you so you do t have to be inconvenienced by driving there for nothing when you are ill. Go across the street to CVS. They care about their customers and are very friendly. Shame on you Walgreen's!

text: Rude staff in the pharmacy!!! The girls have such an attitude and act like they despise waiting on me. Not just once, but EVERYTIME I have been in the store to pick up medication. Do not do business at this Rite Aid, I won't ever go back!

name: Tyler Smelley
text: I LOVE this Rite Aid! I've shopped here for years, since it was Harco. But the last few years have been great. I'm a frequent Rite Aid shopper, and this location is the closest to my home. The management (Ms. Donna and Ms. Debbie) have a great staff that sincerely care about their customers. Miss Christine and Miss Mimi always greet me by name and make sure that I know about specials and sales on products that I purchase frequently. And since it's a former Harco building, it's so much larger than other Rite Aid locations in the area. I've never used the pharmacy here but have heard good things from other shoppers...

name: S Wyatt
text: Fast, friendly service and prices are competitive.  Lots of items from home health to snacks and beauty supplies. Fantastic selection of skin care products for all types but I especially appreciate the array of options for sensitive skin and diabetic skin products. Service with a smile and never a problem returning an item that isn't amenable to my needs as long as I have the receipt.

name: fred b
text: If I could give zero stars I would! This pharmacy lacks in basic customer service, very rude employees in the pharmacy. When I wanted to transfer to another pharmacy and the new pharmacy called them, they told the new pharmacy we had nothing to transfer and no refills. Very next week I got notified by Walgreens that my refills were ready. When I called today to let them know I was transferring to Publix pharmacy the girl was argumentative and hung up on me. We will never grace the door of another Walgreens and we will tell everyone we know! Terrible experiences there! Also they discourage use of the GoodRX card for those that are uninsured!

name: Laura Franklin
text: Slowest pharmacy I’ve ever been to. Not just once, but EVERY TIME. Pharmacist are more interested in talking to each other, laughing it up. PITIFUL SERVICE!!!! Changed mine and my husbands to CVS. They are fast and friendly. Strictly business there.

text: First review? Well then. I had to make a trip to Trinity Medical and was asked to pick up some Alka Seltzer and cough drops for some visitors. I wasn't asked to show my ID, I offered to show my ID.  If I was asked to do that in the first place, none of this would have happened. However, if you stick to the current deals, use your rewards card, and load coupons, you can save a great deal.

name: Emily Busby
text: The two pharmacist are usually very helpful and nice and the cashiers are too but they give me trouble just about every month concerning my prescription. I take one prescription a month which is a schedule three or four narcotic I believe. I go to my doctor and he writes my new prescription every 28 days. I take two a day which equals 56. I drive almost two hours to this doctor and live in a rural area that never has this medicine so I always stop at this Walgreens and every time they tell me they can’t fill it until the next day or I have to wait two days even tho my doctor schedules my next appointment on the exact day my medicine runs out. For example I got my prescription filled there last month on 2/5/20. Went yesterday after my appointment to fill my script for this month which ran out yesterday. Waited in traffic and in line for over 20 minutes only for the cashier to tell me she can’t fill it until tommorow. I didn’t even waste my time explaining to her that I couldn’t turn around and drive two more hours again the next day or that my medicine ran out yesterday so technically I could have gotten it filled two days early as per the narcotic laws. I’m not sure if she dosent pay attention to the quantity and counts thirty days or she just dosent care to actually read the directions on the prescription. This is also a medicine that if I don’t take it causes extreme withdrawals so I ended up having to drive 30 plus miles out of my way and wait two to three days for another pharmacy to fill it. Got home and called and asked them via the phone if I was eligible to get it filled yesterday and the lady said yes. Needless to say these people don’t understand that some of these medicines are people’s lifeline and they don’t understand the danger and inconvenience of having to drive all around the country and risk your health all because they can’t take twenty seconds to read a prescription look up last day it was filled and count 28 days. Drove 30 miles to another pharmacy keep in mind another WALGREENS pharmacy and they told me I could have gotten it filled Sunday. Done with Taylor road. They also charge me(no insurance same medicine and same amount every month never changes) anywhere from 180$-300$ went to another Walgreens paid 112$ explain that.

name: Clayton Waring
text: Got snapped at by the clerk when my card didn’t go through. While I️ was moving the money to pay the rest of my balance, the clerk and the woman behind me in line started having a very rude and judge mental conversation about me not being able to afford makeup and then judging me for wearing makeup. Before this I️ was in the store for 15 minutes and was never asked if I️ needed help. If you are a service worker you can at least pretend to be nice or even have some manors.

I, along with three other cars, just sat at the pharmacy drive--thru line waiting to be served for more than 10 to 12 minutes. I could not believe that they allowed one car to sit at the window so long, where in comparison to CVS, you would be asked to pull around so that others would be served while you were waiting on your prescription. The car in front of me was not given any consideration when they finally pulled up to the window at the        6 p.m. - closing time. I have never seen anything like this from a customer service standpoint -- and I have seen bad service.
Unfortunately my insurance has forced me to use Walgreens for my pharmacy needs but I am going to look for another location.

The pharmacy staff at this location have been absolutely amazing. After even just a short while of moving into the area, they remember who I am always, and call when a prescription doesn’t look right.
They really hustle there and manage to keep great customer service!

name: George Stewart
text: The pharmacy tech that was there was unprofessional. She had an attitude with me that was terrible. I plan on taking my business to CVS

name: Leslie Coggin
text: I love this Walgreens. The people are on their toes and super nice. The head pharmacist, Macie, goes out of her way the does g

name: Ann Cruit
text: Do not buy Walgreens generic otc drug brands!  I was talked into buying their brand of ClaritinD. It does NOT work!  After taking one pill and being absolutely miserable, I asked to return it and get the Claritin brand. No go. So now I have to 10 days to even get more since you have to sign for it. Being a severe allergy sufferer, this will pretty much make me sick. Thank you for endorsing an inferior product.

name: Tara Shope
text: Usually quick pharmacy turn around on filling prescriptions and the drive thru is convenient. This locations is almost always well stocked and clean. Staff are generally friendly and helpful. Great BOGO sales on products with the discount card.

name: Heather Simonetti
text: Called in a refill for my son at 5pm. Was told the prescription would take 15 to 20 minutes. I arrived at the location at 6:30 prescription not ready. An hour later the prescription had still not been filled. Then when it was they did not have enough medication.

name: Christian Mays
text: They open at 7. I had the worst stomach pains once over night from acid reflux, and was able to go there early in the morning and get some meds super fast. Helpful staff.

name: SaintMegery15
text: Love coming here whether it's to drive thru and pick up a script or popping inside to see if there are any good deals! It's nice and clean inside, and anytime I have been thru the drive thru it has been a pleasant experience! I love that the have milkbones for my dog whenever she gets to tag along!

name: Ross U
text: Friendly staff and a great selection of general products. Never had a problem here!

name: J T
text: Worst pharmacy service I've ever experienced. There's no reason getting a prescription filled should take an hour. I'd rather go anywhere than here.

name: Geneva Bedell
text: Have most items needed for health and beauty

name: Jacqueline Burgin
text: I love my new hair color and cut done by master stylist, Linda Henry.

name: Dominique Hudson
text: got my eyebrows waxed here, and Cynthia was an absolute delight! very fun to talk to and did a great job!

name: Kellie Nelson
text:
JCP Salon DOES NOT deserve a star!! It would not allow me to post until a star was pressed..
Sm treet5 need to go back to school..If you can't do color the way the customer ask you,explains to you & also shows you by bringing in multiple pics then tell them,don't act like you do when you know you don't & can't...It breaks my heart when my daughter is crying because the stylist messed up her hair.. Just sad!!!!!!!!!!

name: Steven Sykes
text: Very happy with my cut

name: Jessica S
text: The woman who did my hair overcharged me, cut me too short, and gave me the wrong color.

name: Caitlin Carson
text: This Walgreens is always extremely busy. I’ve had to wait for 20 minutes in the drive through. They take at least 45 minutes to fill prescriptions. I scheduled my first Covid vaccination here and even that took 45 minutes. I came back today just now to get my 2nd vaccination and waited at the window for 5 minutes. Then someone told me it would be a while because 3 people were in front of me and the vials had to be taken out of the refrigerator to get to room temperature. They don’t seem to have enough staff. Either it’s that or they do not have a good workflow process. Do anything you can to avoid this location. They are very scattered and seem very unorganized. At least the girl was polite and told me it would be a while. That’s why they got 3 stars instead of 1. Time is valuable though and no one should have to wait for more than 10 minutes to get a shot. The actual shot doesn’t take that long. Because of this I left and don’t know when I will reschedule or if I will reschedule. But it won’t be at this location.

name: Han Bowers
text: Technician yelled at me. they also said all of my prescriptions outload infront of others (HIPPA doesn't apply for these guys?). Manager would not give me the 3 minutes to talk to me after they asked what they could do for me?? If I could leave negative stars I would. Please do not go here if you want to be treated like a customer - I've been treated better at the Birmingham DMV

name: Cookie and milk duarte
text: I have been going to 119 HWY for 10yrs they used to have a good customer service good employees, but this couple of yrs they have had the worst in the pharmacy they never have my prescription they don’t know when they’re going to have it, and they take for ever. Then at the registers at front they have bad attitude like they don’t want no one at the store. They have to change or they will be loosing a lot of customers.

name: Chris Wilson
text: The wait was a bit long at the pharmacy but I enjoyed browsing while I waited. Staff friendly enough and store clean.

name: Corey Hand
text: The worst. The pharmacy takes FOREVER to fill prescriptions. It doesn’t matter how busy (or not) they are, they’ll take forever. We switched to a Walgreens in another town and STILL get our prescriptions faster than this one so much closer to where we live. Definitely wouldn’t recommend to anyone.

name: Kelley Pesnell Conner
text: Don't expect Speedy kind. Or efficient service in this place.

name: Connie C
text: This SLOWEST drive thru pharmacy!!! I drive by and they are often lined up 5 and 6 deep.

name: Brett Koger
text: We switched to Walgreens because of location convenience.  We have had several prescriptions filled here and the majority of them have had an issue where we have had to return the next day to pick up our prescription.  We have notifications set up but we never receive a call or text that something is wrong.  The staff is always friendly and that is why they got two stars.

name: Marybeth Flack
text: Always “lose” prescriptions. Hardly anybody answers the phone or solves the problems.

name: Jessica Gallegos
text: Hadn’t been in a few months, but today I did a quick stop and service was the worst I ever had there! Cashier looked like she didn’t want to be there, didn’t even say a “hello how are?” NOTHING NOT ONE WORD the whole time when checking out not even the told or anything!! Every unprofessional!!

name: Anthony Roberts
text: Seems like I am on here once a week at least to pick up something. Staff is always very nice and helpful. I never have a problem finding what I need.

name: Wayne Roberts
text: Waited on phone over 20 minutes to ask a question about a medication I take that was recalled because of serious issues. When I finally got to talk to a pharmacist, they were less than friendly and told me I would have to bring it in before they could tell me anything. Since they gave out the medication and are aware of any problems concerning a medication, you would think they would know what's going on with it. Only time I have used Walgreens. Used CVS for years, never waited for a extended period to talk to anyone, even when they were really busy. The pharmacy at Walgreens in Alabaster gets a failing grade and will not get my business. CVS I'm coming back.

name: Akinajin
text: We switched to Walgreens because it was a more convenient location. Since switching we have not had a single prescription filled in a reasonable amount of time. The pharmacy seems to have no sense of urgency. We will be switching back to CVS.

name: tlsullivan22
text: This place has the slowest pharmacy I have ever been too.Doctor called prescription around 8 a.m. It still wasn't ready after 2:00 pm.This particular location is awful and poorly managed

name: Jessica Garcia
text: I made the mistake of having a prescription sent to alabaster location at 5:40 when they were closing at 6. I stood in line and had prepared to ask them to send my prescription to another pharmacy if it was too late. They agreed and said the other pharmacy would have to call them, which they said they would. I asked if I was set to leave, was given the okay, so I headed to other pharmacy. They call me and say walgreens never answered their phone, that it went straight to operator saying they were closed. So, I head into traffic to go to hoover's 24 hour walgreen's pharmacy and I call ahead so they know to get it ready since it is a 30 minute drive. I was on hold for 25 minutes before they picked up. I figured--they must be super busy. 5 minutes later, I pulled in and there was no line, no rush, no hurry... they told me I had to wait another 15 minutes. When I inquired about why I had to sit on hold for 25 minutes if they weren't busy, "I dont know" was all I got. This woman could see I'd been crying (from worry over my kid) and I didn't get an apology, a rush job, kindness, nothing. If they had picked up their phone, they could have done the transfer for me at 6, and I could have had the meds to my sick child an hour earlier.

name: Sarah Trotti
text: The pharmacy has been so unhelpful. I am a student at The University of Montevallo and I am not from the area thus promoting me to transfer my prescriptions down here. This process has tried to take place every day for the past three days and I am finally giving up. The first day it took me 10 minutes before I could talk to anyone and when they finally answered they said their phones are down. That in itself was sketchy because I was talking to them through their phone system, but I figured that they got something working. I gave them my information and they said that they would get that in and text me from their personal phones (that in itself is odd) when it was ready. I never got that text. The next day, around the same time, I went down to the store to pick up school supplies and I asked them about my prescriptions. They had to take my information again as their phones were down and their computers were acting up the day before and they didn't get to my order. They asked me when I needed it and I said the next day and they told me they would call it in right then. The final day, at the same time of day, I called them and checked my status of my prescriptions by putting in my information that they had to take twice (well technically three times as they asked me twice the first day for my information). They said that they couldn't find my order. They have some issues they need to work out if they want to be in this business as my prescription is actually important to my health.

name: Billy
text: First and last time I will ever use this Pharmacy. Very rude when I first called. After already having such a stressful week, I don't need some lady being a sassy b**** to me when I've never used this Pharmacy. When they said it was ready, I immediately went to the store. Took 10 minutes (probably longer) to receive my prescription.

name: Ariel Henderson
text: my favorite walgreens love yall

name: Michael O’Dell
text: Great Pharmacy and staff.

name: The Lawn & Life
text: Ridiculously slow

name: Kitten Cookie

name: Tara Doaks
text: Unfortunately the pharmacist there on 1/19/16 around 12:31 pm was incredibly rude, not helpful in any way.

name: Robert Clark
text: Clean aisles, friendily smily cashier-Jason.

name: Buddy Smith
text: Didn't have what I needed. But had some good boys on other things I purchased.

name: Step East
text: I had just gotten in the store good when they played the announcement that they were closing in 5 minutes and I needed to bring my purchases to the front of the store to be checked out. I didn't have any purchases yet and according to my cell phone, I still had 15 minutes before the official closing time. I thought I'd at least be able to pick up the important things on my list and that shouldn't take any longer than 5 minutes. As I started walking toward the back of the store, the cashier yelled for me to come check out right away. I informed her of the time and asked what the urgency was all about, and she told me that their system was problematic and that it would automatically close out the day 10 minutes early, on occasion. If this were to happen, the transactions for the day would be inaccurate, and I understood what a mess that would be for the accounting people, so I told her goodnight and left without buying anything. It was only a 10 minute drive to Hoover, and the Walgreens there is open 24/7 and never closes. They really need to get the system fixed asap so that more business isn't turned away from that store.

name: JESSICA LAMONT
text: been doing bussiness with them for 8 years!

name: BM Media
text: I wish I could give a 0! I walked in and the guy working was practically asleep on the counter playing a game on his phone.. I said waking in “rough night” he looks at me and said “just bored out of mind”.  I said I’m sorry and he mumbled something so I couldn’t hear it.  I go to check out and he wouldn’t look at me.  As he rang me up I waited for him to ask for my members card he never did.  I said I had a Walgreens card and he said “oh how am I suppose to know you think I can read minds”. I just paid and left him to his game.  Pathetic store...don’t waste you time or money!

text: The costumer service was great, a young lady named Diana was very helpful and nice when it came to helping me with my shopping, I feel like Walgreens should have more employees like her.

And when you don't get off work until 9:30 and you depend on them to be open until 10 so you can buy your kids cold medicine, closing 15 minutes early makes a difference. Especially when 3 other cars pull up and wonder why they are closed. Very disappointed. Will never shop here again.

name: Michael Shull
text: The man behind the counter was unfriendly and did not seem to grasp the concept of a HDHP. My prescription was filled name brand and my coupon was only good for generic. I asked to have it reordered generic and he gave me grief about it. Pardon me for wanting to save $200.

text: Best place in SE Huntsville for redbox!

name: Hans Glomme
text: Until today I was very satisfied with Wallgreens. Today I went there to find out if I am eligible to receive a Covid 19 vaccination and if Wallgreens uses Johnson & Jonson. The female pharmacist was very friendly and told me that they would use Phizer as the vaccine. When I asked her if she could tell me where I could get vaccinated with Johnson & Johnson, a pharmacist of about 30 years interrupted me in a very rude way and said that they would not give me any information. I think a "We do not know" or "We are unfortunately not allowed to give any information like this" would have been enough. This was in any case, the last time I visited Wallgreens to Carl T Jones. Too bad you can not also give 0 stars. I have rarely met such an unfriendly person. On the one hand I have been a customer there and on the other hand I am much older than the young gentleman and therefore deserve a little respect.

text: Their pharmacy is top notch! 👌

name: Dominique Hudson
text: The pharmacy tech, I believe her name was Margaret, had such a nasty attitude toward me!! She seemed so irritated to have to do her job. Kept cutting me off and was such a smart elect. Sad. To be honest all the staff just had nasty attitudes, all looked miserable and didn’t even smile at me or say hi or anything. but she was who I dealt with the most. Not going to be back to this location and that’s a fact. 👌🏻
